intro: Pellegrinia coccinea, commonly known as the red pellgrinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of bright red, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Pellegrinia coccinea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
